meanings.definition: A white liquid produced by female mammals to nourish their young.
meanings.sent1: The baby drank the milk from its mother.
meanings.sent2: I poured milk over my cereal for breakfast.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten knocked over the milk jug.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was like a soothing milk to my soul.
meanings.sent5: The milk was so fresh, it tasted like a cloud in a glass.

meanings.definition: To draw milk from (a cow or other mammal).
meanings.sent1: The farmer milks the cows every morning.
meanings.sent2: She learned how to milk a goat at the farm.
meanings.sent3: He tried to milk the cat, but it didn't work.
meanings.sent4: The con artist tried to milk money from unsuspecting victims.
meanings.sent5: The magician seemed to milk coins out of thin air.

meanings.definition: To exploit or defraud (someone), especially by taking money from them.
meanings.sent1: The scammer tried to milk the elderly couple out of their savings.
meanings.sent2: She realized too late that he was trying to milk her for all she had.
meanings.sent3: The salesman attempted to milk the customer by selling fake products.
meanings.sent4: The corrupt politician was known to milk public funds for personal gain.
meanings.sent5: The greedy businessman would milk any opportunity for profit.
